sense.name: a shop, mercantile establishment
sense.commentary: STORE[+enterprise][+commercial][+mercantile] Note: implies customers visit the site and make purchases
sense.examples: Liquor stores are not allowed in our town. The big discount chain opened another store in China last month. Can you mind the store while I run to the bank? You can buy these items on our website, but we don't keep them in the store. She asked to speak to the store manager.

sense.name: supply or stock of something, an accumulation
sense.examples: John showed us his store of rare brandies. Their firm has maintained a store of funds for just such emergencies. My store of batteries and light bulbs is getting low.

sense.name: digital computer memory
sense.commentary: STORE[+repository][+computer][+memory] Note: this may be British, sounds quite marked to my American ear
sense.examples: The computations are done in store. How much store does your computer have?

sense.name: a depot or warehouse
sense.commentary: STORE[+repository][+warehouse] Note: does not serve customers (generally)
sense.examples: The furs were kept in cold store during the summer months. They built large stores to hold the grain.

sense.name: a measure of value
sense.examples: I wouldn't set much store in what they think about this. The industry sets great store by the Fed chairman's remarks.

sense.name: in readiness or in preparation
sense.examples: There is a big surprise in store for you. We don't know what lies in store for the currency markets.
